fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article that referred to solar panels said “the government has decided that, from April, when people install new systems, it will no longer pay for the surplus electricity they produce”. The government has proposed the termination of such payments, but is still considering objections (Weatherwatch, 13 November, page 40). • Other recently corrected articles include: National Trust has £30m invested in fossil fuels Body that rejected Iceland Christmas ad ‘faced storm of abuse’ Iceland’s Christmas TV advert rejected for being political
